markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

fresnobee.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for the Fresno Bee, a newspaper covering news, sports, and entertainment in Fresno, California.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Fresno Bee is owned by the publicly traded McClatchy Company, which operates 30 daily newspapers across the U.S., including its flagship publication, The Sacramento Bee. It also operates McClatchy DC, a news agency based in Washington that provides political coverage to McClatchy’s newspapers. McClatchy generates the bulk its revenue from subscriptions and advertising for its printed and digital products.

McClatchy-owned newspapers have won numerous awards, including two Pulitzer Prizes in 2017.

Content

FresnoBee.com reporters cover crime, business, local government and politics, among other topics, in six counties in California’s San Joaquin Valley.

A page on FresnoBee.com showcases the newsroom’s data-centric news stories, which in 2018 included examinations of the rate at which local senior citizens were victims of violent crime, campaign spending in city council races, and municipal tax breaks offered to businesses.

FresnoBee.com publishes national political stories written by reporters in McClatchy’s Washington bureau, along with content from other McClatchy-owned newspapers and The Associated Press.

Credibility

FresnoBee.com lists more than 40 journalists who are part of the Bee’s newsroom. Those journalists often conduct their own original reporting and interviews, and stories frequently embed primary source documents referenced in articles. Headlines accurately represent story content. Opinion pieces appear in a designated section.

FresnoBee.com publishes correction notices to articles found to contain errors. The notices usually appear at the top of stories. The website posts a contact form specifically marked for correction requests on its Contact Us page.

Transparency

An About Us page provides some background information on the newspaper and discloses that it is owned by McClatchy. FresnoBee.com provides email addresses and phone numbers for the newsroom’s reporters, editors, designers, and other staff. It also provides the same contact information for its president and publisher.

Advertisements are differentiated from editorial content. After a previous version of this Nutrition Label was published, McClatchy sites, including FresnoBee.com, began labeling articles from content recommendation firm Zergnet with the heading “FROM OUR ADVERTISING PARTNERS.”

History

The McClatchy family founded the Fresno Bee in 1922. FresnoBee.com has been published online since at least 1998.

Editor's Note: This Nutrition Label has been updated, and its rating has changed, after McClatchy sites began labeling paid content hosted by content recommendation firm ZergNet. The site now meets NewsGuard’s standard for labeling advertising. The rating and Nutrition Label have also been changed to reflect that FresnoBee.com now discloses that it is owned by McClatchy.

Written by:
Sam Howard
